title: How to Catch Groudon Without Using a Master Ball

steps.title: Buy 10 Timer Balls.
steps.content: Buy 10 Timer Balls. These can be obtained from Rustboro City Poké Mart.

steps.title: Go to the Cave of Origin in Sootopolis City.
steps.content: Go to the Cave of Origin in Sootopolis City. Have at least level 35 to 45 Pokémon, preferably with high hit points.

steps.title: Go inside.
steps.content: Go inside. Wander your way to Groudon (Level 45) and your Red Orb will start to glow. This will cause Groudon to walk toward you.

steps.title: Groudon's moves are Bulk up, Fire Blast, Slash, and Earthquake.
steps.content: Groudon's moves are Bulk up, Fire Blast, Slash, and Earthquake. Send out a Flying-type first and stall the Groudon. The Timer Balls' catch rate doesn't go up if the Pokémon is weak, just if a lot of turns have been taken, so the more you stall, the better chance you have at catching it.

steps.title: Eventually after a decent amount of turns, you should catch him with one of your timer balls.
steps.content: Eventually after a decent amount of turns, you should catch him with one of your timer balls.

steps.title: Get a Quick Ball and loads of Timer Balls.
steps.content: Get a Quick Ball and loads of Timer Balls.

steps.title: Get some Pokémon with no weakness to his moveset and high hp.
steps.content: Get some Pokémon with no weakness to his moveset and high hp.

steps.title: Find Groudon.
steps.content: Find Groudon. Start battle. His standard moveset = Earthquake, Fire Blast, Solarbeam, Slash.

steps.title: Throw Quick Ball on the first turn.
steps.content: Throw Quick Ball on the first turn.

steps.title: If it doesn't work, wait 10+ turns, then start throwing Timer Balls.
steps.content: If it doesn't work, wait 10+ turns, then start throwing Timer Balls. If you run out, revert to the previous save.
